intro: Dipyrena infuscata, commonly known as the dark dipyrena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
